connector.description:
Upload data to MinIO.

In the header, you can set the `file` / `ce-file` property to specify the filename to upload.

If you do not set the property in the header, the Kamelet uses the exchange ID for the filename.

camel.kamelet.minio-sink.accessKey.name: camel.kamelet.minio-sink.accessKey
camel.kamelet.minio-sink.accessKey.description: The access key obtained from MinIO.

camel.kamelet.minio-sink.secretKey.name: camel.kamelet.minio-sink.secretKey
camel.kamelet.minio-sink.secretKey.description: The secret key obtained from MinIO.

camel.kamelet.minio-sink.endpoint.name: camel.kamelet.minio-sink.endpoint
camel.kamelet.minio-sink.endpoint.description: The MinIO Endpoint. You can specify an URL, domain name, IPv4 address, or IPv6 address. Example: http://localhost:9000

camel.kamelet.minio-sink.autoCreateBucke.name: camel.kamelet.minio-sink.autoCreateBucket
camel.kamelet.minio-sink.autoCreateBucke.description: Specify to automatically create the MinIO bucket.

camel.kamelet.minio-sink.keyName.name: camel.kamelet.minio-sink.keyName
camel.kamelet.minio-sink.keyName.description: The key name for saving an element in the bucket.
